channel.title: Smother strokes
channel.description: Ok i have made a very simple paint like applet but the problem is if that there is gaps between the printed circles and i want it flow but i haven't got a clue how. I am sorry if i haven't used the correct terms but i kind on new to this thanks.

item.title: Smother strokes
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:13, topic:302390”]except he couldn’t, because he didn’t know the word for what he was trying to do

the word was interpolate

jesus christ[/quote]exactly. no need to spoon feed him. i gave him the concept he was looking for and a link to wikipedia. done

abraham2119:

no need for him to be spoon-fed, i gave him the concept he was looking for and now its up to him to do a little search on it and implement it into code

Then don’t. And also don’t be a prick and link to wikipedia. They can look it up for themselves.

item.title: Smother strokes
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:9, topic:302390”][quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=398713.msg2958820#msg2958820 date=1253030444]
Perhaps BAsh was pointing more towards the fact that discussing a specific type of interpolation would be more beneficial than pointing out something that was reasonably obvious.
[/quote]it wasnt obvious for the op, as mopman said, or else he wouldnt have asked[/quote]Perhaps not, but to alot of others it was obvious, if you had provided a more specific response, it would mean the OP would get what he wants and other people wouldn’t also have to post specifics. (Which would pretty much render your original post pointless).

item.title: Smother strokes
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Perhaps BAsh was pointing more towards the fact that discussing a specific type of interpolation would be more beneficial than pointing out something that was reasonably obvious. For example, linear interpolation wouldn’t be great for circles if they don’t have alot of points. Perhaps some type of spline interpolation would be better.

Read full topic

item.title: Smother strokes
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

if i understand you correctly, your problem is that the application wont receive all of the mousemoved events, so it receives events like this, for example:

x: 15 - y: 20 x: 23 - y: 20 x: 31 - y: 20 rather than:

x: 15 - y: 20 x: 16 - y: 20 x: 17 - y: 20 x: 18 - y: 20 x: 19 - y: 20 x: 21 - y: 20 x: 22 - y: 20 x: 23 - y: 20 x: 24 - y: 20 x: 25 - y: 20 x: 26 - y: 20 x: 27 - y: 20 x: 28 - y: 20 x: 29 - y: 20 x: 30 - y: 20 x: 31 - y: 20

for this, you should interpolate

Read full topic
